    public class GameScreen
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
    Class with all the graphic implementations of the screen in which the user will actually play.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void createTable(int[][] mapValues)
      We create the whole map with buttons so later on you can tap on each tile and get important information about it.
      private void finishGame()
      When the game is finished, we deploy a message, and generate the url that creates the graphic tree on the git repository.
      private void initTreeAndColors()
      We create the graphic tree with the first node (which is obviously the initial coordinate of the character), process the invalid nodes, and paint the adjacent tiles with the corresponding color.
      private boolean isGameFinish()
      We check if the actual coordinate in which the character is right now, is the same as the final tile, so the game would be finished.
      private void loadBoard()
      We load the board with the essential, initial and most important information, like the initial and final tile, information about any tile the user taps, and show the tutoria if its the fist time executing the app.
      protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Initialization of all the basic data that the game and board will need to be playable, like biomes, colors, codes, coordinates, and buttons.
      boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
      Method called by system on Back button pressed.
      private void setAdyacentFieldsAndColor(int y, int x)
      We receive a coordinate and paint the adjacent fields with their corresponding color.
      private void setFieldColor(int y, int x, int color)
      We set the corresponding color of a specific tile (actually the one in which the character is right now).

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initialization of all the basic data that the game and board will need to be playable, like biomes, colors, codes, coordinates, and buttons.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Bundle with the Strings from the previous intent.

      • initTreeAndColors

        private void initTreeAndColors()
        We create the graphic tree with the first node (which is obviously the initial coordinate of the character), process the invalid nodes, and paint the adjacent tiles with the corresponding color.

      • setAdyacentFieldsAndColor

        private void setAdyacentFieldsAndColor(int y,
                                       int x)
        We receive a coordinate and paint the adjacent fields with their corresponding color.
        Parameters:
        y - y coordinate.
        x - x coordinate.

      • setFieldColor

        private void setFieldColor(int y,
                           int x,
                           int color)
        We set the corresponding color of a specific tile (actually the one in which the character is right now).
        Parameters:
        y - y coordinate.
        x - x coordinate
        color - color code of the tile.

      • loadBoard

        private void loadBoard()
        We load the board with the essential, initial and most important information, like the initial and final tile, information about any tile the user taps, and show the tutoria if its the fist time executing the app.

      • createTable

        private void createTable(int[][] mapValues)
        We create the whole map with buttons so later on you can tap on each tile and get important information about it. Also, this creates the letters and numbers on the first column and first row.
        Parameters:
        mapValues - the whole compilation of tiles for the map.

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
        Method called by system on Back button pressed.
        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        item - menu item corresponding to the activity.
        Returns:
        a true value.

      • isGameFinish

        private boolean isGameFinish()
        We check if the actual coordinate in which the character is right now, is the same as the final tile, so the game would be finished.
        Returns:
        a true or false value.

      • finishGame

        private void finishGame()
        When the game is finished, we deploy a message, and generate the url that creates the graphic tree on the git repository.
